title: 1915 Michigan Wolverines football team
text:
The 1915 Michigan Wolverines football team was an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> team that represented the <a href="University%20of%20Michigan">University of Michigan</a> as an independent during the <a href="1915%20college%20football%20season">1915 college football season</a>. In its 15th season under head coach was <a href="Fielding%20H.%20Yost">Fielding H. Yost</a> the team compiled a 4–3–1 record and outscored opponents by a total of 130 to 81. After winning its first four games, the Wolverines lost three consecutive games.
Right guard <a href="William%20D.%20Cochran">William D. Cochran</a> was the team captain. Key players included left halfback <a href="John%20Maulbetsch">John Maulbetsch</a>, quarterback <a href="Lawrence%20Roehm">Lawrence Roehm</a>, fullback <a href="Cedric%20C.%20Smith">Cedric C. Smith</a>, center <a href="Walter%20Niemann%20%28American%20football%29">Walter Niemann</a>, and guard <a href="Frank%20Millard">Frank Millard</a>. Maulbetch was selected as a first-team All-American by Tommy Clark and as a second-team player by Walter Eckersall and Monty. He also received the Heston-Schulz Trophy as the team's most valuable player.
